page.title: 05LOCAL ATTITUDES LIFE STYLES
page.content: We stopped a man in Kirkham.His name was Mr.Peter Wells.He was taking his dog for a walk as he walks to Wrea Green every day to see his aged mother.He had lived in Kirkham all his life.He said he had seen it change a lot but he would not like to see any more buildings or flats as he very much liked the rural environment.He enjoys observing the wild life of the area.He said many old streets had been knocked down to make room for other buildings.For example,the old Willows School had been knocked down and they had built another new school and club across the road.He thought that the population of Kirkham had not increased very much.Mr.Wells works at the Social Services Department in Kirkham where he is a general handyman at the Training Centre.
